scenarioDescription:
The HD 11755 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 11755 is a star with 0.72 times the mass of the Sun, and 20.58 times its radius. It is located 766.61 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 10.2 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 11755 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 11755 system


HD 11755 b

HD 11755 b was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory observatory, in 2015-12, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 11755 b is 1790.340 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 11755 b is 12.800 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 11755 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 11755, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory.
name: HD 11755 - System With 1 Exoplanet
